scheme_name: Operation of River Rafting / Kayaking Activities
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote adventure tourism by regulating and authorizing rafting and kayaking operations in the state. Under this scheme, rafting companies are granted permission to operate, and licenses are issued to qualified river guides.
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;Operation of River Rafting / Kayaking Activities&quot;, implemented by the Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board under the Tourism Department, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to promote adventure tourism by regulating and authorizing rafting and kayaking operations in the state. Under this scheme, rafting companies are granted permission to operate, and licenses are issued to qualified river guides. This initiative not only generates revenue for the state but also provides significant economic opportunities for individuals and businesses involved in the tourism sector.
benefits: Authorized rafting companies are permitted to operate, ensuring safety and quality standards in adventure tourism. Licenses are issued to river guides, creating job opportunities for skilled individuals. Local entrepreneurs and businesses associated with the tourism sector benefit financially from increased tourist activity.
eligibility_criteria:
For Rafting/Kayaking Firm Operation:
The firm must be based in Uttarakhand. It should have valid registration under the Societies Registration Act. Possession of a valid Uttarakhand Travel Business Registration Certificate is mandatory. The firm must have a minimum of three years of experience in conducting adventure activities.
For River Guide:
The applicant (River Guide) should be a resident of Uttarakhand for at least ten years or be a native of the state. The applicant should have advanced practical/technical knowledge of aero sports. The applicant should be healthy. The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 50 years. The applicant must have passed at least Class 10 (High School). The applicant should be fluent in swimming (swimming proficiency is essential.). The applicant should possess a valid First Aid Certificate issued by the Red Cross, St. John Ambulance, or any other recognized institutions. The applicant should know rescue techniques.

steps: Step 1: The applicant must submit the application along with all required documents to the Tourism Department office or the CEO of the Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board. Step 2: The Department scrutinizes the submitted applications and forwards them to the Technical Committee for further evaluation. Step 3: Following the inspection and review by the Technical Committee, the Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board communicates the decision regarding the grant of permission to all applicants along with reasons where applicable within a maximum of 45 days.
Note: Applications for river rafting/kayaking activities in the Ganga River can be submitted from 1st July to 31st July each year. For other rivers, applications are accepted throughout the year.

documents_required: For Rafting/Kayaking Firm Operation: Photocopy of Insurance certificate Proof of Purchase of Raft and Safety Equipment's Valid Registration under the Societies Act Uttarakhand Travel Business Registration Certificate Documents related to minimum of 3 Years' Experience in Adventure Activities List of Skilled and Unskilled Employees Details of Local Community Participation List of Rafts/Kayaks/Safety Equipment's Photocopy of Log book of training details of Rafting/Kayaking Tariff Card of Rafting/Kayaking Packages Details of Office Details of Rafts, Kayaks, and Safety Equipment Application Fee of ₹1000/- For River Guide License: Bio-Data of River Guide Identity proof Proof of residence/domicile certificate Proof of age Proof/certificate of swimming Educational qualification certificates A First Aid Certification from a recognized training center like Saint John Ambulance or a similar institution
